properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 7 at 1:48AM EST until February 8 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service Blacksburg Va has issued
a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia...

NEW RIVER MISSING Allisonia affecting Pulaski and Wythe Counties

Two to four inches of rain have fallen in the New River Basin since Wednesday night.
Runoff from this rainfall will result in rises along the New River and minor flooding
at Allisonia.

The National Weather Service in Blacksburg Va has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the New River at Allisonia
* from early this morning until Saturday morning
* At 1AM Friday the stage was 8.1 feet.
* Flood Stage is 8.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* The river will continue rising to near 8.6 feet
* Impact...at 9.0 feet...Parts of Julia Simpkins Road..ROUTE 693 on the
right bank are cut off.
* Flood history...this crest compares to a previous crest of 8.5 feet
on Apr 20 2019.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive through flooded areas...the water may be much deeper
than you think.

Listen to noaa weather radio or your favorite media outlet for later
statements or warnings.
